intro: Indigofera basedowii subsp. longibractea, commonly known as the long-bract indigofera, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated bracts that surround its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with compound leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting well to poor soil conditions and drought.
